summary: Anne B. Misita was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents provide her name, and in some cases, her annual salary and gross pay for the specified periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the SCA, but her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Anne B. Misita's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her contribution are not detailed in the provided documents.
